title: Prepare datasets to Bayesian colocalisation analysis using Bayes Factors — coloc_local
code: coloc_local(   eqtl,   gwas,   beta_col_eqtl = "beta",   se_col_eqtl = "varbeta",   snp_col_eqtl = "snp",   pval_col_eqtl = "pval",   MAF_col_eqtl = "MAF",   N_eqtl = NULL,   type_eqtl = NULL,   s_eqtl = NULL,   sdY_eqtl = NULL,   beta_col_gwas = "beta",   se_col_gwas = "varbeta",   snp_col_gwas = "snp",   pval_col_gwas = "pval",   MAF_col_gwas = "MAF",   N_gwas = NULL,   type_gwas = NULL,   s_gwas = NULL,   sdY_gwas = NULL )

title: Prepare datasets to Bayesian colocalisation analysis using Bayes Factors — coloc_local
text: eqtl dataframe eqtl gwas dataframe gwas beta_col_eqtl regression coefficient SNP dataset1 se_col_eqtl variance beta dataset1 snp_col_eqtl character vector snp ids, optional. used merge dataset1 dataset2 retained results. pval_col_eqtl P-values SNP dataset1 MAF_col_eqtl minor allele frequency variants N_eqtl Number samples dataset 1 type_eqtl type data dataset 1 - either "quant" "cc" denote quantitative case-control s_eqtl case control dataset, proportion samples dataset 1 cases sdY_eqtl quantitative trait, population standard deviation trait. given, can estimated vectors varbeta MAF beta_col_gwas regression coefficient SNP gwas se_col_gwas variance beta gwas snp_col_gwas character vector snp ids, optional. used merge dataset1 dataset2 retained results. pval_col_gwas P-values SNP dataset1 MAF_col_gwas minor allele frequency variants N_gwas Number samples dataset 2 type_gwas type data dataset 2 - either "quant" "cc" denote quantitative case-control s_gwas case control dataset, proportion samples dataset 2 cases sdY_gwas quantitative trait, population standard deviation trait. given, can estimated vectors varbeta MAF

title: Prepare datasets to Bayesian colocalisation analysis using Bayes Factors — coloc_local
Prepare datasets to Bayesian colocalisation analysis using Bayes Factors — coloc_local
code: # also can: # check_dataset(result$dataset1) # check_dataset(result$dataset2) # my.res <- coloc.abf(result$dataset1, result$dataset2)  # only using the pval and SNP and maf # result_coloc <- coloc.abf(dataset1=list(snp=result$dataset1$snp,pvalues=result$dataset1$pvalues,type="cc", s=0.001, N=359399), dataset2=list(snp=result$dataset2$snp,pvalues=result$dataset2$pvalues, type="quant", N=31684), MAF=result$dataset1$MAF)

code: forest_plot(   data,   abline = TRUE,   col_padj = FALSE,   p.adjust.methods = "bonferroni",   p.adjust.n = NULL,   xlim = c(0, 4),   ticks_at = c(0, 0.5, 1, 2, 3) )

title: Return the forest plot — forest_plot
text: data harmonization(using function harmonise_data) abline abline forest plot col_padj forestplot figure adjust_pval col p.adjust.methods p.adjust.methods,c("holm", "hochberg", "hommel", "bonferroni", "BH", "", "fdr", "none") p.adjust.n number comparisons, must least length(p); set (non-default) know ! xlim forestploter packages param,xlim=c(0,4) ticks_at forestploter packages param, ticks_at=c(0,0.5,1, 2, 3)

what: How to get rsID from chromosome and position — get_rsID_from_chrpos
title: How to get rsID from chromosome and position — get_rsID_from_chrpos
How to get rsID from chromosome and position — get_rsID_from_chrpos
code: get_rsID_from_chrpos(   dat,   col_chr = "chr",   col_pos = "start",   col_ref_allele = "refAllele",   col_alt_allele = "altAllele",   col_snp = "SNP",   build = "37",   pop = "EUR",   database = "dbsnp" )

title: How to get rsID from chromosome and position — get_rsID_from_chrpos
text: dat dataframe exposure outcome col_chr chromosome default "chr_col". col_pos chromosome position col_ref_allele Name column non effect allele. Must contain characters "", "C", "T" "G". default "refAllele". col_alt_allele Name column effect allele. Must contain characters "", "C", "T" "G". default "altAllele" col_snp Required name column SNP rs IDs. default "SNP". build version pop investigated population database dbsnp database

title: How to get rsID from chromosome and position — get_rsID_from_chrpos
